channel.title: 4 Points that Aren't Coplanar
channel.description: I need someone to draw me a picture of 4 points that aren't coplanar, I can't figure out what they are =[.

item.title: 4 Points that Aren't Coplanar
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

The four points in a simple tetrahedron are not co-planar. Any three points out of the four are, but not all 4.

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/8/83/Tetrahedron.jpg
http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/7/70/Tetrahedron.gif

Hopefully that’s what you’re looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Points that Aren't Coplanar
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:7, topic:145094”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=198758.msg1770367#msg1770367 date=1190354342]
Are you sure?

First, that’s three points, and second, aren’t they then on the same x pane? If you look at the table from the side like this:

| |

Then the ends of the legs are all at the same height level, therefore they share a pane and are not coplanar, I believe.
[/quote]

One leg short. Not removed.[/quote]

Sorry. I interpreted your statement wrong. I read ‘short’ as in “It’s short a leg”, like missing.

Still, wouldn’t the other legs share a similar pane though?`

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Points that Aren't Coplanar
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:6, topic:145094”]Are you sure?

First, that’s three points, and second, aren’t they then on the same x pane? If you look at the table from the side like this:

| |

Then the ends of the legs are all at the same height level, therefore they share a pane and are not coplanar, I believe.[/quote]

One leg short. Not removed.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Points that Aren't Coplanar
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

xxlegitxx:

A table with one leg short. The ends of the legs are non-coplanar points.

Are you sure?

First, that’s three points, and second, aren’t they then on the same x pane? If you look at the table from the side like this:

| |

Then the ends of the legs are all at the same height level, therefore they share a pane and are not coplanar, I believe.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Points that Aren't Coplanar
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

A table with one leg short. The ends of the legs are non-coplanar points.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Points that Aren't Coplanar
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

In geometry, a set of points in space is coplanar if the points all lie in the same geometric plane. For example, three points are always coplanar; but four points in space are usually not coplanar.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Points that Aren't Coplanar
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Coplanar means that two points are on the same pane.

So just draw a dodecahedron or something and make 4 points on panes that aren’t across from each other… I think.

Read full topic
